title: Etchmiadzin Cathedral
summary: Etchmiadzin Cathedral[upper-alpha 3] (Armenian: Էջմիածնի մայր տաճար, Ēǰmiatsni mayr tačar) is the mother church of the Armenian Apostolic Church, located in the city of Vagharshapat (Etchmiadzin), Armenia.[upper-alpha 4] According to most scholars it was the first cathedral built in ancient Armenia,[upper-alpha 5] and is often considered the oldest cathedral in the world.[upper-alpha 6]
